results.title: Man the manager
results.brief_description: Designed to increase employee pride and identification with the organisation. Illustrates methods of integrating the employee, increasing their understanding of their job and skill in performing it. Case histories show three situations in which failure to follow management principles had a detrimental effect on the organisation.

results.title: Man the builder
results.creator_credit: George Klein and Audio Visual Education Centre, South Australia
results.brief_description: By simple animation the film tells of the human need for shelter. At first we existed in caves, then in holes underground with a parallel development from hunting wild animals for food to primitive agriculture. This led to the establishment of village life and the hunting tribe developed into the stable community.

results.title: Man against fire
results.brief_description: The story of the fight to save forest resources from wildfire by using planning, research, training and experience. Also details the need for technology, surveillance, strategy, equipment, systems and co-operation. Describes co-operative fire control - federal, state and local - to protect the nation’s water supply, timber, wildlife, recreation and scenic wonders as well as property and lives.

results.title: Mambush: the craftsman and the artist
results.creator_credit: Jerry A Callner and Callner Film Productions
results.brief_description: Master craftsman Yitzhak Mambush describes and demonstrates the results of blending of the painters and tapestry maker’s talents. Visiting the artistic community of Ein Hod, Israel, where Mambush works, the process of preparing for weaving is shown. Mambush characterises his translation of the painters art into a tapestry as not simply a reprise of the canvas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerry A Callner and Callner Film Productions

results.title: Mallee - land of challenge
results.creator_credit: R.G. Downes and Soil Conservation Authority of Victoria
results.brief_description: How the Mallee farmer is overcoming the problems of former bad land use and wind erosion by modern agricultural methods. Soil conservation competitions, educational field days, and advisory services also are helping the farmer to improve land use. The film shows how this vast Mallee country has a big production potential for cereals, wool and meat.

results.title: Male and female in plants and animals
results.brief_description: Introduces the concept of male and female in plants and animals. Animation is used to show the locations of reproductive organs in different kind plants and animals: algae, flowering plants, insects, fish, amphibians, birds, and mammals, including humans. Through microphotography, various kinds of sperm cells and egg cells are closely examined. A human sperm is observed entering an egg cell.

results.title: Making their senses make sense
results.creator_credit: Elsie McKibbin and Center for Developmental and Learning Disorders
results.brief_description: Discusses methods to care for and explores different activities to help teach children who are perceptually disabled. These children may find difficulty in learning, refining motor skills, and coping with safety aspects in everyday life.

results.title: Making pottery. No. 1
results.creator_credit: Harvig Jensen and Hartvig Jensen Film Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how raw clay is processed in preparation for modelling. Demonstrations show a jug and a flower pot being made; creative use of engraving and decorating; the final firing and glazing processes.
